Archetype Feature Description: The Undead lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.
Starting at 1st level, you have resistance to necrotic damage, and your hit point maximum can't be reduced. Additionally, you are immune to being frightened by undead creatures.

Starting at 6th level, your patron's curse allows you to strike at the life force of others. When you hit a creature with an eldritch blast, you can deal extra necrotic damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 damage).

Starting at 10th level, you can use your action to force one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier). On a failed save, the target takes 2d10 necrotic damage. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage.
The damage increases to 3d10 at 14th level. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

At 14th level, you gain the Mystic Arcanum feature. You can choose the "Dead Walk" spell as your Mystic Arcanum spell, which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. This spell allows you to raise the corpses of the dead to serve you. The details of the "Dead Walk" spell can be found in your class description.
